channel.title: Fricken Square Corners on Nancy's Creative Mess
channel.description: Recent content in Fricken Square Corners on Nancy's Creative Mess

item.title: *Subdued Thank You*
item.description: Back in early July we lost a very good friend after a short illness… it was devastating to lose a friend that we loved so much. She was one of my regular customers in terms of card orders. Her husband approached me after her funeral, asking if I would please make him some thank you cards to send out to people who helped out so much during her brief illness and after her death… and I said “of course”.

item.title: *Black White and Gold*
item.description: The most difficult part of this card was getting the gold cord to look good…. LOL! I’m still not sure I like how it turned out but after about 12 minutes of fiddling with it, I decided to leave it alone. Card Info *Cardstock: Stampin’ Up! Basic Black *Images: Concord & 9th Hello Sunshine *Ink: Versafine Clair Nocturne *Dies: Waffle Flower Additional Circles *Etc: Stampin’ Up! embossing folder; gold cord

item.title: *Addicted to CAS #227*
item.description: There’s a new challenge at Addicted to CAS today… time to show us your clean and simple creations featuring the colour pink! I don’t know why but I struggled with this prompt…. but then I gabbed out some stencils and had a little play with them. I stencilled the pink swirls first and then put a second stencil on top of the first stencil and used Glimmer Paste so that the sparkly circles only showed up on the pink swirls.

item.title: *Striped Flower*
item.description: This was a great way to use a little bit of patterned paper… Card Info *Cardstock: Stampin’ Up! Granny Apple Green *Paper: Stampin’ Up! Pattern Party *Dies: A Jillian Vance Design Open Daisy; MFT Celebrate *Tools: Perfect Layers; Fricken Square Corners *Etc: foam adhesive

item.title: *CAS Colours & Sketches #483*
item.description: There’s a new colour challenge at CAS Colours & Sketches that starts today…. these colours are PERFECT to use on a black background if you like that sort of popping neon appearance. We always love to see what others do with our sketches and colour combinations so I hope you’ll play along and share your card with us! I absolutely LOVE how some colours just POP off of a black background.

item.title: *In Color Thanks*
item.description: I just love the 2022-24 Stampin’ Up! In Color colours…. but I don’t find I use all of them much. I am really drawn to the red, green and light blue but not the two darker colours as much. So I grabbed all five for this card. Card Info *Cardstock: Stampin’ Up! Sweet Sorbet, Parakeet Party, Tahitian Tide, Orchid Oasis, Starry Sky *Images: Altenew Sincere Greetings *Ink: Versafine Clair Nocturne

item.title: *Stencilled Thanks*
item.description: I am back to work this afternoon after my week of isolation thanks to Covid. I am feeling really good except a lingering tiredness but I’m sure that will get better with time. I really need to just take planned holidays from work instead of illness and injury!! A friend asked for some thank you cards recently so I did up a few different designs for her. I really liked the look of using the last bit of ink on the blending brush to go over the white spots left behind by stencilling so I did a few like this one…

item.title: *Black & White with Sparkle*
item.description: It’s been a long week away from my creative space as I’ve been isolating in the main bedroom of our home because I got Covid. Honestly I didn’t have a lot of energy some days so I didn’t miss the creative time all that much, but as I started to feel better I wished I could sit at my desk and play. I am now feeling better and out of isolation but wearing a mask when others are around.

item.title: *Bright on Black*
item.description: I absolutely love the look of bright colours on black… I just love how they POP with brightness!! These new In Color colours from Stampin' Up! are perfect for this!! Card Info *Carstock: Stampin’ Up! Basic Black, Tahitian Tide, Sweet Sorbet, Parakeet Party *Images: Taylored Expressions Simple Strips *Ink: Versafine Clair Nocturne *Dies: Stampin’ Up! Pierced Blooms; Taylored Expressions Simple Strips *Tools: Perfect Layers; Fricken Square Corners

item.title: *Floral Best Wishes*
item.description: Why do the months of June, July and August seem to fly by while December, January and February go by at a snails pace? I am in awe that summer in already half over! I know there’s still lots of warm sunny weather to come, but it feels like it’s going by so fast! I saw a card using this layout on Pinterest and wanted to play with it. For some it would still be considered clean and simple, but for others it is not.

item.title: *Your Day Sparkles*
item.description: I really love this glitter paper from Stampin’ Up! It’s in all of the new In Color colours that I love and I love that I can use one tone of it or the ombre effect. It adds a great little “something extra” to my cards! Card Info *Cardstock: Stampin’ Up! Basic Black, Sweet Sorbet, In Color ombre sparkle paper *Images: Pink Fresh Studio Happy Birthday Sentiments *Ink: Versafine Clair Nocturne

item.title: *Softened the Look*
item.description: I will admit that I love stencils… and I have a few dozen… but I hardly use them because I feel intimidated by them. I think it’s because I prefer the clean and simple style for my creations and stencils tend to be pretty busy. I’ve been trying to pull them out to play with a little more often… For this card I used the ink through the stencil and then the same colours of inks over top without the stencil to soften the look a little bit.

item.title: *Addicted to CAS #225*
item.description: The code word at Addicted to CAS is Nautical… I hope you’ll play along. The design team has created some fun ideas that you can see HERE. I had a bit in my stash that would have been ok for this challenge but nothing that was speaking to me… so I used some dies to create my nautical themed card instead. Card Info *Cardstock: Stampin’ Up! Sweet Sorbet, Starry Sky

item.title: *Less is More #469*
item.description: There’s a colour challenge at Simply Less is More… and that challenge is traditional Christmas. I hope you’ll dig out some of your Christmas stash and play along with us! To me, the traditional colours of Christmas are red, green and gold…. and I think “sparkle” should be a Christmas colour as well LOL! I just love sparkly things, especially for Christmas cards! Card Info *Cardstock: assorted glitter papers *Images: Simon Say Stamp Good Cheer

item.title: *Ombre Stripes*
item.description: Another quick post from me as I am dealing with a seized muscle in my back and sitting at my desk might kill me… thankfully I have a few cards made and ready to share since I can’t sit here long enough to craft (and creating while in pain isn’t easy… creativity doesn’t flow) I have a die by Pink Fresh that does slimline strips and I like to use that when making thin strips because I know they will be accurate.

item.title: *CAS on Friday #235*
item.description: Good morning friends… a quick post from me today to share my creations for the current CAS on Friday challenge. The current challenge is “silhouette” and instead of stamping, I did a black die cut instead. I used my Copics to create a little rainbow and then put the die cut floral spring on top of it. Because I used Copics, I used a smaller panel and put it on top of a white card so that the ink bleeding wouldn’t show through to the inside of the card.

item.title: *Color Throwdown #699*
item.description: I love the inspiration photo from the current Color Throwdown challenge so I had to play along. But then I was stumped as to what I wanted to do… I do much better with sketch challenges than colour challenges I think! I pulled out a stencil I haven’t used yet and this is the result. I was going to orient my card the other way however the glitter paste made a mess in one area under the stencil so I flipped the panel and covered it with my sentiment!

item.title: *Freshly Made Sketches #342*
item.description: I loved the ease of the sketch by Kim at Freshly Made Sketches this week. I combined the idea of using patterned paper with Kim’s idea of horizontal stripes to create my card. I also used a stamp and die that I bought YEARS ago that I’ve never used! Card Info *Cardstock: Stampin’ Up! Basic Black, Granny Apple Green *Paper: Stampin’ Up! Pattern Party *Images: Scrapbook & Cards Today; MFT Bitty Birthday Greetings

item.title: *CAS on Friday #178*
item.description: The current challenge at CAS on Friday is to make a thank you card. I love these open daisies by A Jillian Vance Design. I paired them with some of the new Stampin’ Up! In Color colours to create my card for the challenge. Card Info *Cardstock: Stampin’ Up! Tahitian Tide, Parakeet Party, Sweet Sorbet, Starry Sky *Images: Taylored Expressions Simple Strips *Ink: Versafine Clair Nocturne *Dies: A Jillian Vance Designs Open Daisy; Taylored Expressions Simple Strips

item.title: *Stencil Background*
item.description: I had fun with some light stencilling for my card today. I wanted some pretty colour without it being overwhelming. I love layering stencils since it’s so easy to do one colour at a time… it’s achievable with a regular stencil but you have to be careful with the masking! I actually used two different stencils for this card but only used a small portion of each, moving it around to fill my background.

item.title: *CAS Colours & Sketches #476*
item.description: It’s time for the last sketch challenge for the month of June with CAS Colours & Sketches… our sketch this time is a slimline card and I went for a mini-slimline as I prefer that size. I took, a large floral stamp but only used a part of it so it would fit on my card. I even pulled out my Copics to do a little colouring (which isn’t easy as my wrist heals)

item.title: *Color Hues #43... take 3*
item.description: When you find a colour combination you just love, sometimes you have to go with it. That’s me with the colours blue and green… specifically Tim Holtz Twisted Citron and Salty Ocean. Stampin’ Up! Parakeet Party and Tahitian Tide are right up there for me too! And of course, I get to play along one more time with the challenge at Color Hues I don’t think I’ve *ever* entered one challenge more than one time… and this is my third entry!

item.title: *Christmas Craft Creations Trees*
item.description: There’s still some time to play along with the Christmas Craft Creations June theme of TREES! This is a great challenge to help you get a few Christmas cards made throughout the year. I had promised myself to make more Christmas cards before October and while I’ve done that, it’s really only been for this challenge! Maybe I should make one day a month where I make only Christmas cards.

item.title: *Color Hues #43... take 2*
item.description: Is it good or bad that this Pink Fresh Studio stamp is one stamp with several images that you stamp, stencil and cut all at once? It’s good because it’s easy, it’s bad because you get stuck with several cards that look similar. The good news is that this is a LOVELY set and it’s easy to create with it! And I get to play along with Color Hues again!

item.title: *Color Hues #43*
item.description: I’ve been struggling in the craft room in the last few days… I sit there, wanting to create but nothing comes. Thankfully I have some cards already made to be able to share with you… and it just so happens to fall in to the color challenge at Color Hues! For the card today, I used the Pink Fresh Studio Rainbow Floral stamp, die and stencils… but instead of using all of the layers of the stencil, I only used two to create the bit of blue on the flowers and the bit of green on the leaves.

item.title: *Time Out Challenges #144*
item.description: It’s time for a new challenge at Time Out Challenges… up for grabs this week is a $25 credit at Top Flight Stamps! Play along with us by sharing your card HERE. Our prompt for this challenge is “tropical”. I had some fun with the new Stampin’ Up! Colours and an old stamp and die set. Some of the leaves are stamped, some are cut out… I was able to create a little more dimension this way.

item.title: *The Best Day Ever*
item.description: I worked on this card a few weeks ago while my wrist was still pretty sore and useless (instead of kind of sore and useless like it is now) and decided to play with a design that featured patterned paper. Doing this made it all a little easier for me and my wrist but still allowed for me to feel like I was being creative. Card Info *Cardstock: Stampin’ Up! Night of Navy

item.title: *In My Thoughts*
item.description: I’m back without another washi tape creation. The stamp and die with this Pink Fresh Studio set are one piece so it makes more sense to stamp it all and then cut it all… the same goes with the washi tape. When I cut out the wreath for the card a few days ago, it only made sense to do it all. These were the other pieces I had so I threw them all on a panel to create a card.

item.title: *Color Hues #42*
item.description: I saw a few cards on some Facebook groups I’m on as well as on Instagram, using the current challenge from Color Hues… and while I don’t often reach for yellow, I really felt like I wanted to play along with this challenge. I love black and white with a pop of colour… I usually do red, but yellow sure does look happy! Card Info *Cardstock: Stampin’ Up! Daffodil Delight, Basic Black

item.title: *Color Throwdown #695*
item.description: I pulled out a stencil that I purchased right before I broke my wrist. Ink blending still isn’t easy (and honestly it can hurt) but this was quick and I was able to get through it. I loved the look of the colours in the current Color Throwdown Challenge so that’s what I went with for this card. Card Info *Cardstock: Stampin’ Up! Basic Black; silver mirror *Images: MFT Big Birthday Sentiments

item.title: *Less is More #466*
item.description: It’s time for a new clean and simple challenge at Less is More! We want to see your “masculine” themed cards for the next two weeks! Share them with us HERE!!! I always struggle with masculine cards. I don’t have much for masculine images and I tend towards purples and reds in my colour selections. I will admit, I almost skipped this challenge! I was poking around Pinterest and searched for “masculine colour combinations” and something similar to what I used popped up.

item.title: *Paper Craft Crew #473*
item.description: I was scrolling Pinterest yesterday and found a card sketch I liked… clicked the link and found a new to me challenge page called Paper Craft Crew. I had a little mojo this morning so I decided to play with their sketch. I dipped in to my bin of extra die cuts and put together this card… Card Info *Cardstock: Stampin’ Up! Granny Apple Green, Balmy Balmy Blue *Images: Pink Fresh Studio Rainbow Floral; Taylored Expressions Simple Strips

item.title: *Freshly Made #538*
item.description: I was able to get myself caught up with design team duties and found a little time to play with some current challenges. Today I’m sharing the card I created for the latest sketch at Freshly Made Sketches. I was able to grab this flower from my bin of extras to add a pop of colour to my black and white card. Card Info *Paper: MFT Black & White Stripes

item.title: *CAS Colours & Sketches #472*
item.description: Welcome to the last challenge of the moth for CAS Colours & Sketches. As it is the fifth challenge this month, we have both a sketch and a colour combination for you to use! I will admit, I am not thrilled with my card. Maybe my border is too wide? It just feels like the Island Indigo overwhelms the rest of the card. The rest of the design team has inspiration for you HERE and I hope that you’ll play along with us!

item.title: *AAACards #216*
item.description: It’s time for a new challenge at AAACards! AAA Cards is a clean and simple challenge blog that posts a new challenge every two weeks. We love to share our ideas on the cue cards and, more importantly, love to see what others come up with for our challenges! I sure hope you’ll play along and share your creations with us HERE! Let me explain our graphic a bit… for challenge #216, we want you to use the colours that you see in the graphic… and *optionally* we’d like to see a shaker card.

item.title: *Washi Tape Background*
item.description: I had so much fun playing with ink on washi tape, that I decided to play again. This is a great technique. You just ink up the sticky side of the washi tape and put it down on your cardstock and then pull it up again. It really gives some fun texture to your card. This is great for me as I have some washi tapes that I will probably never use on cards so I can do something creative with it (instead of just using it as repositionable adhesive)

item.title: *CAS Colours & Sketches #471*
item.description: We’re back with another sketch with the team at CAS Colours and Sketches… We look forward to seeing what you create this week following the sketch below. Remember to keep your creations clean and simple! You can share your cards with us HERE! I will admit, this sketch had me scratching my head for a little bit. I just couldn’t figure out what I wanted to do. I was flipping through my bin of dies and saw the balloons and decided to see what I could come up with.

item.title: *Washi Tape*
item.description: Happy Sunday all… in true Calgary fashion, our first long weekend of “summer” has delivered us a mixed bag of weather. Friday it was really windy and wet and we had a little snow falling from the sky. Saturday was cool and mostly cloudy. So far this morning the sun is shining and it’s warming up a little. This is what you get with an elevation of 1045 m above sea level (that’s 3428 ft).

item.title: *Less is More #465*
item.description: It’s time for a colour challenge over at the Less is More blog. For this challenge we are playing with my favourite colour combination… RAINBOW! There is some wonderful inspiration to be seen created by the rest of the design team.. click HERE to check them out! I absolutely love creating with rainbows… they can be bright, muted, pastel, jewel toned… whatever you feel like! I received my new Stampin’ Up!

item.title: *Simple Sympathy*
item.description: I have guidelines (for myself, not for others) as to what a sympathy card should look like. I don’t judge what others create, but I do like to keep the cards I create simple and “toned down”. I needed a card for friends who recently suffered a loss and managed to create this card using some extras that were in my dish. Card Info *Cardstock: Stampin’ Up! Old Olive *Images: Pink Fresh Studio Small Butterflies; Taylored Expressions Simple Strips

item.title: *Blue Ink*
item.description: I had my first session at physical therapy yesterday and while things are better than they had been, I still feel like there is a very long way to go before this injury is a thing of the past. I will be working on stretches and trying to use my right hand/arm/wrist as normally as possible. There is still some swelling and the joint is extremely stiff. I’m feeling a little discouraged as I write this because I just want this whole thing to be a memory.

item.title: *Metallic Watercolours*
item.description: I got these Kuretake watercolours for Christmas and have been too intimidated to play with them. I am not an artist. I am not artistic. I don’t know how to colour. But I do know how to scribble on paper LOL Card Info *Cardstock: Stampin’ Up! Basic Black; black watercolour paper *Dies: MFT Celebrate *Tools: Fricken Square Corners *Etc: Kuretake Gem Colors Watercolours

item.title: *More Tulips*
item.description: I haven’t been doing a lot of crafting as my wrist has been sore again but I hope to sit in my craft room for a while today… and maybe some mojo will flow. Just a quick post from me today with more of those lovely Crafty Meraki tulips.

item.title: *Addicted to CAS #220*
item.description: Challenge #220 at Addicted to CAS is all about flowers…. we can’t wait to see your beautiful flower creations! You get a bonus card from me today…. I created my alcohol ink background and fit two flower dies on it … and since they are so similar I decided to share them both in one post I really hope you’ll play along and share your cards HERE!

item.title: *Special Tulips*
item.description: Happy Friday the 13th crafty friends! If you’ve been here for a while, you know that my hubby and I celebrate Friday the 13th as we met (at a bar in the late 80s) on a Friday the 13th and got engaged on a Friday the 13th (our oldest son was born on the anniversary of the day Bruce proposed but it wasn’t a Friday). We’ve been married 31 years (or it will be on June 1) so we figure it’s a pretty good day.

item.title: *Birthday Smiles*
item.description: You can see that this card looks a little similar to the one yesterday… it’s another of the distress ink blending panels I did. In this one I feel like the Villainous Potion is a little too dark… Card Info *Cardstock: Stampin’ Up! Basic Black *Images: MFT All Smiles *Ink: Versafine Clair Nocturne; Tim Holtz Distress Ink in Villainous Potion, Peacock Feathers, Twisted Citron *Tools: Perfect Layers; Fricken Square Corners

item.title: *Less is More #464*
item.description: Happy Saturday!! I hope that wherever you are right now that the sun is shining…I’m hoping that Mother Nature got the memo that it’s now May and hopefully the spring snow will be done for the year. It’s currently pretty lovely, but here in Calgary it can change without much notice! It’s time for a new clean and simple challenge at Less is More… for challenge #464 we want to see your clean and simple creations using a tag.

item.title: *Addicted to CAS #219*
*CAS Colours & Sketches #467*
item.description: This will be my last post with CAS Colours & Sketches until my wrist heals enough to craft again. My surgery on Friday went well and I’m in less pain than I was before surgery. I have no idea when I’ll be able to do things with the right hand again… I’m guessing I’ll have some answers after my surgical follow up on the 2nd. But for today, my card using the current sketch at CAS Colours & Sketches… I wanted to leave my background white but I just couldn’t.

item.title: *Unicorn Sparkles*
item.description: I knew when I bought this Whittle Unicorn die that it wasn’t all that “whittle”… but I sure wish it was. This is just a little too large for me, but as you can see, I bought it anyway! Card Info *Cardstock: Stampin’ Up! shimmer white, Basic Black; Lawn Fawn holographic *Images: Pink Fresh Studio Happy Birthday Sentiments *Ink: Versamark; Tim Holtz Distress Picked Raspberry, Mustard Seed, Spiced Marmalade, Twisted Citron, Salty Ocean

item.title: *Sparkles*
item.description: Some more of those Pink Fresh Studio rainbow butterflies that I cut out … I added a few matted layers and a strip of black and white stripes. Card Info *Cardstock: Stampin’ Up! Basic Black, Lemon Lime Twist *Paper: MFT Black & White Stripes *Images: Pink Fresh Studio Small Butterflies, Happy Birthday Sentiments *Ink: Versafine Clair Nocturne; Tim Holtz Distress Picked Raspberry, Orange Marmalade, Mustard Seed, Twisted Citron *Tools: Fricken Square Corners; Perfect Layers

item.title: *You Make My Heart Happy*
item.description: This is the last of the cards using this stamp set… at least for a few days. I will admit I did something else with a few of the dies a few days ago so there will be more coming. I hope I haven’t played with them too much in the last bit and will find that I don’t want to pull the set out again! Card Info *Paper: MFT Black & White Stripes

item.title: *Less is More #462*
item.description: It’s time for a new challenge with the team at Less is More. As you can see from the graphic below, the prompt is “occupations”. As always, we hope you’ll play along with our challenge and share your creations with us HERE! I struggled a bit with the challenge as I don’t really have any stamps that scream “occupations” to me… so I had to think outside the box a little.

item.title: *Another Flower*
item.description: I’m not quite done with the images from that Pink Fresh Studio stamp and die set… I think there’s still a few more coming up. Can you tell how much I enjoyed playing with them? Card Info *Cardstock: Stampin’ Up! Concord Crush *Images: Pink Fresh Studio Beautiful Blooms; Taylored Expressions Simple Strips Birthday *Ink: Versafine Clair Nocturne; Memento Tuxedo Black; Copics *Dies: Pink Fresh Studio Beautiful Blooms; Taylored Expressions Simple Strips; MFT Stitched Circles

item.title: *Time Out #211*
item.description: Happy Thursday crafty friends… the team at Time Out Challenges is back with a new photo inspiration challenge. We can’t wait to see what you create using the photo below as inspiration. Share your creations with us HERE for your chance to not only be chosen to play along as a Guest Designer in an upcoming challenge but to win a $15 credit to shop at our sponsor, Poppystamps! I used a layered diamond die cut pieces that I cut in half to create some blue and green and grey mountains.

item.title: *CAS Colours & Sketches #464*
item.description: Bhavya is the host at CAS Colours & Sketches for the month of April. She has chosen a great ‘garden’ themed set of colours for us to use as her first colour challenge this month. I can’t wait to see how others interpret these colours! For our colour challenges, you must use all of the stated challenge colours. You may also use neutral colours; however, the challenge colours should be the most noticeable ones featured on your card.

item.title: *A Lot More Fabulous*
item.description: Good morning crafty friends… just a quick post from me today to share another card with this gorgeous floral stamp set by Pink Fresh Studio. Card Info *Cardstock: Stampin’ Up! Seaside Spray *Images: Pink Fresh Studio Beautiful Blooms, Happy Birthday Sentiments *Ink: Memento Tuxedo Black; Versafine Clair Nocturne; Copics *Dies: Pink Fresh Studio Beautiful Blooms *Tools: Perfect Layers; Fricken Square Corners *Embellishments: Nuvo Aqua Shimmer; Pink & Main Rainbow Pearls

item.title: *Beautiful Blooms Birthday*
item.description: A few weeks ago my friend Bonnie and I went to one of our favourite local stamp stores after I was done work. I will admit I bought a few things I didn’t need… but I am so happy I did! This fabulous floral set from Pink Fresh is perfect for my colouring preferences… You’ll see a few cards using this set in the next several days as I stamped them up at once and spent some time colouring.

item.title: *Floral Swag*
item.description: I just love these floral swag stamps and dies… I stamped this one, coloured it and cut it out so that it could go over the edges of the layers I placed on the front of this card. Have I told you lately how much I LOVE my perfect layers tool to create those beautiful 1/16" borders??? Let me tell you about another tool I am in LOVE with lately. My friend at Calgary Laser Creations is a papercrafter at heart and she has created some acrylic tools to help you get your layers on even and straight.
